website_summaries.verdict: High-quality prenatal vitamins that support preconception, healthy pregnancy, and fetal development.
pros: Fermented with beneficial probiotics and whole foods making them gentle on the stomach
Deliver 100% daily value of iron along with B vitamins
Also enriched with vitamin D3, vitamin C, and zinc
cons: May need to take the prenatal vitamins at least three times a day to achieve best results

customer_reviews.title: Better off with a different brand
customer_reviews.text: I didn’t read the fine print... you have to take 3 of these a day!!!! I am pregnant and Mom to a toddler, I’m not even bothering taking these. I have the rainbow brand that is just one per day. I’ll save these overpriced pills for nursing when it’s not as big of a deal if I’m miss a dose or two. Very disappointed. Oh, and I still get nauseous off of 1/3 of the recommended daily dose so I’m not a fan at all. Can’t return without paying a fee so I’ll just save you all the mistake I made hopefully.
customer_reviews.author: Tiffany

customer_reviews.title: Best Vitamins
customer_reviews.text: I will keep this short and sweet and just say that these are the highest quality prenatal vitamins you will find. If you want the best for your baby, this is your vitamin. They never upset my stomach, granted I haven't had bad morning sickness. Absolutely recommend
customer_reviews.author: Jessica

customer_reviews.title: Unbelievable results!
customer_reviews.text: I will have to say, It took me about a month to really notice the effects. I have so much energy, my hair has went from feeling like a tiny rat tail, to a horse tail. I've always had thick hair, but after my last child it thinned out so much. I even had thin spots by my temples. This is unbelievable. I'm just stunned. I feel so good everyday. I'm so glad I found these. I feel if I'm benefiting from these so much, then my baby must be too:)
customer_reviews.author: Mary H

customer_reviews.title: My baby had trisomy 18
customer_reviews.text: I checked to see what I was taking in the months leading up to my current pregnancy because my daughter has trisomy 18. I am not old enough to be at risk for this. There is a study implicating mthfr problems with trisomy 18. This is the vitamin I was taking when the egg my daugher was matured and was being conceived. I later took smarty pants and Naturelo but it was too late. In the future I will take naturelo or seeking health vitamins and be extra vigilant. I do not believe this is the best vitamin for preventing chromosomal problems.
customer_reviews.author: chicken tikka masala

customer_reviews.title: Best Multi EVER!!!!
customer_reviews.text: The best multivitamin I’ve ever used! I take these or the prenatals year round but they help curb the crazy hormones before and after child birth. My hair stop falling out and I had energy again. every doctor needs to be handing these out to woman not the expensive crap ones they promote...
customer_reviews.author: Greta

customer_reviews.title: DON’T BUY THIS
customer_reviews.text: I usually don’t write reviews on amazon but for this I have to. These vitamins made me feel horrible: 1) made me super bloated for 2 weeks; 2) very very crampy; 3) anxious; 4)shortness of breath;4) nauseous sometime .... I stopped taking them yesterday because I got scared of how bloated I was , I thought I will explode. I hipe people read this review cuz I didn’t read the bad ones when I got it. Because this product is sponsored it doesn’t mean it’s good or better than others!!!
customer_reviews.author: Ecaterina

customer_reviews.title: Great vitamin for a great price!
customer_reviews.text: I love this prenatal because it is one of the few brands which use whole real foods instead of lab-made vitamins. I also can take these on an empty stomach and have never had a stomach ache or any other problems. The pills are rather large and you have to take 3 per day, so if you have trouble swallowing pills, I’d reccomend a pill crusher. I loved also that these are available for purchase on amazon—-as I didn’t want to drive the store for more with a brand new baby. (My midwife recommended I continue taking them while breastfeeding) plus they are cheaper than I can get them at Sprouts!
customer_reviews.author: Lisa Koffman

customer_reviews.title: Advertised folate is not what I received
customer_reviews.text: Ordered for folate, and received folic acid. False advertising! Very displeased that I spent $25 and can’t return this item.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I was excited to try these because of the plant based ingredients but they gave me serious stomach issues. I didn’t even finish the bottle despite how expensive they were. I gave 2 stars for the high quality of the ingredients but I wouldn’t recommend to people with sensitivity to gas and bloating.
customer_reviews.author: Courtney

customer_reviews.title: Satisfied.
customer_reviews.text: After a few days of taking these pills, I did become constipated, but I would not be able to pin point the exact source since I am pregnant, and it could be an array of possibilities. I personally don't have an issue with the size of the pills because I can swallow big pills. The taste does not bother me either. I don't have any issues so far, but I do wish there were more pills in the jar. The jar was hardly filled halfway.
customer_reviews.author: kells

customer_reviews.title: Love love these prenatals!
customer_reviews.text: Would definitely recommend to anyone who’s looking for great prenatals that don’t make you sick. This is my 4th pregnancy and I’ve had horrible morning / all day sickness, everything I found at the stores locally just made me more nauseous. These don’t make me nauseous at all & I can take them on a empty stomach before I start my day. They’ve also helped reduce my nausea, improve my energy levels throughout the day as well. Definitely going to continue into their postnatals after I have my daughter next month!
customer_reviews.author: AmazonCustomer789

customer_reviews.title: Love these!
customer_reviews.text: I've been using these prenatal vitamins for about 5 years now. I started using them when I was pregnant with my first child (I have two now and am TTC a third) and have taken them pretty much ever since. They don't hurt my stomach and haven't had any negative effects. Maybe TMI but I don't have electric yellow urine after taking them like I have after many other vitamins I've used in the past. I feel like this is because my body is actually getting the vitamins better instead of expelling them with my wastewater.
customer_reviews.author: Jesslyn Ostrokol

customer_reviews.title: I have taken this prenatal with all 3 of my kids and I love it. It makes me feel great
customer_reviews.text: Does not upset the tummy even with extreme morning sickness. I have taken this prenatal with all 3 of my kids and I love it. It makes me feel great, makes my hair beautiful, my nails long and my skin flawless. This stuff is a must for pregnancy. It is organic, non gmo and a tad pricy but way, way worth it because it does not make me sick to my stomach. Definate must ..
customer_reviews.author: Mrs. .bought that

customer_reviews.title: No more pixie cut & weak nails
customer_reviews.text: It’s when you’re vitamins tasted like dirt steeped in sort is when you know they’re good for you I’ve been using these for just over a year. My pixie cut grew out so fast, I had to admit to my friends it’s because I’ve been talking alone great vitamins. Now they’re on them, too! I am actually reordering tomorrow before I run out Thank gawd for Prime
customer_reviews.author: Shannon

customer_reviews.title: Best pre natal vitamin you can buy!
customer_reviews.text: This is my go to pre-natal. I’ve been taking these vitamins for over 4 years now and I love them! I tried several other brands but oftentimes I would feel nauseas. I have confidence when taking these on an empty stomach that I will not get sick. I give it only 4 stars just because you have to take 3 a day. Still I love this product and would recommend this to anyone trying to find a natural prenatal vitamin.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Forbush

customer_reviews.title: Stink, but feel comfortable with ingredient quality
customer_reviews.text: Took during both pregnancies. First pregnancy I didn’t have any problems, just had to plug my nose sometimes because the smell would get to me. Second pregnancy I was much more sick and threw these up a couple times. SO much worse coming back up! I couldn’t smell them the rest of my pregnancy because the smell made me sick. I do like the ingredient quality in them though!
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie Skillicorn

customer_reviews.title: Great!!!
customer_reviews.text: I’ve used this vitamins during and after both of my pregnancies.They are a great option if you deal with bad morning sickness.A little pricey but you get good quality in return.I was a little surprised the company sold to P&G as i wasn’t aware but happy they maintained the quality and cleanliness of the product
customer_reviews.author: vesi

customer_reviews.title: Best Vitamins
customer_reviews.text: These are the best vitamins that I have found so far. I was a bit worried about taking them on a empty stomach since I can never eat without getting nauseous but that is the best time for me to take them. You can actually taste the vegi taste in them when burping but that’s ok with me. The PNV prenatals that the doctor prescribes does not go well with my stomach and the gummies make me more nauseous then ever with all the sugar in them.
customer_reviews.author: Princess McDonald

customer_reviews.title: Almost perfect
customer_reviews.text: This is my favorite prenatal I've tried. The only negative things my medical provider had to say about it was that it needed more vitamin c and that the magnesium wasn't in the optimal form for absorption. However, I'm enjoying them because of the iron. I think that was something that my body needed a little extra of.
customer_reviews.author: Alexandria Barron

customer_reviews.title: Finally found One that doesn’t make me nauseous
customer_reviews.text: I was starting to wonder if I would ever find a prenatal vitamin that didn’t make me very nauseous unless I had eaten a lot before I took it but I finally have! I am one happy happy customer definitely putting this on our subscribe and save
customer_reviews.author: Robert R.

customer_reviews.title: Contains Soy!
customer_reviews.text: Many breastfeeding moms like me have been advised to avoid dairy and soy, because it was causing stomach issues for the babies after nursing. Most prenatal vitamins contain soy, I search specifically for products that do not contain soy. On the product description, it only shows a partial list of ingredients. When I received the product, I saw that the ingredients list continued on another side of the packaging, and it says in bold letters "contains soy". Had I known, I would have never purchased this, and now I can't return the product. Very disappointed!
customer_reviews.author: Nancy

customer_reviews.title: Tried vs regular multi-vitamin --
customer_reviews.text: I tried the pre-natal vitamin vs. regular women's vitamin on the suggestion of practitioners nurse but see no difference in how I felt. I do, however, see that there is no difference in the number of broken pills. This is becoming a problem as I am "old school" and never take any pill that is broken.
customer_reviews.author: Denise Smith

customer_reviews.title: 3x daily vitamin and contains soy
customer_reviews.text: I'm so disappointed with myself for not reading the instructions or ingredients; I saw the good reviews and just bought them. When they arrived I saw that you have to take 3 pills a day which is a pain in the ass to remember, and more concerning is the fact that these contain soy. Soy is very bad for you despite what we hear about it being good. Do your research and stay away from any ingredients containing soy.
customer_reviews.author: Erin Sohr

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend
customer_reviews.text: Love these! Wouldn’t take any other brand. They don’t make my stomach hurt, even if I take on an empty stomach. They are big and I have no problem swallowing pills, but they do break in half very easily if you do. I don’t think they taste unpleasant or have a strong taste in general and the ingredients are great! Worth every penny.
customer_reviews.author: Bridget E Cashman

customer_reviews.title: My baby was born very healthy and I felt good throughout my pregnancy
customer_reviews.text: I had a very sensitive stomach and stingy appetite throughout pregnancy. This vitamin never upset my stomach. Most importantly though, my daughter was born SUPER healthy despite the fact that I had to take epilepsy meds and couldnt eat a very colorful diet due to my food aversions.
customer_reviews.author: Hannah

customer_reviews.title: I've taken these prenatals for both my pregnancies and even ...
customer_reviews.text: I've taken these prenatals for both my pregnancies and even when I'm not pregnant. I've never had a vitamin that makes my hair and nails grow faster than this one. It also gives me more energy and I feel healthier all around. My only complaint is having to buy the DHA separate considering that these are already expensive.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very Gentle on the Tummy.
customer_reviews.text: I bought these because regular multivitamins are harsh on my belly. These are so gentle its amazing. I highly recommend these! This is my new regular vitamin. ***update*** Changed to three stars because they made me constipated. I saw this in a previous review but chalked it up to a symptom of pregnancy. But, i am not pregnant and can confirm it is the vitamin.
customer_reviews.author: Molly L

customer_reviews.title: I'm taking this product because my body doesn't seem to ...
customer_reviews.text: I'm taking this product because my body doesn't seem to absorb nutrients as well. I'm actually in my 60's and feel that this products provides more energy than any other vitamin supplement that I have taken.
customer_reviews.author: Eve Underhill

customer_reviews.title: Great Wholesome Vitamin!
customer_reviews.text: I love love love these vitamins! When I got pregnant with my first child, I wanted an organic whole fruit & veggie vitamin to make sure I was getting the most absorbable nutrition possible. These fit the bill. I have been taking them every day since then. I have run out on occasion and switched to another vitamin for a few days until these came to me in the mail, and I could tell with in those few days that my body missed these! I was extr tired, felt "yucky", and my nails would start breaking after a few days.
customer_reviews.author: KC

customer_reviews.title: You pay for what you get
customer_reviews.text: This is a great prenatal. I have a hard time affording it so I knocked it down one star for price point-- that being said-- it's worth paying more to get such a comprehensive and supportive prenatal. You do have to take THREE, which can be challenging during nauseas times but WAY easier to take them Rainbow Lite horse pills. I can take all three at once. Def recommend!
customer_reviews.author: MJ

customer_reviews.title: Love this vitamin
customer_reviews.text: This is such a great prenatal vitamin! I truly believe this vitamin had a lot to do with me not getting sick during my pregnancy!
customer_reviews.author: Dustin Lister

customer_reviews.title: I love these prenatals
customer_reviews.text: I love these prenatals. They are a bit pricey, but like with most things, you get what you pay for. They don't make me nauseous at all like some of the other ones I've tried and I take the 3 pills all at once in the morning. I do take a prenatal DHA as well per my Doctor's recommendation but it looks like this supplement gives you most everything else you need plus more for a healthy pregnancy and baby.
customer_reviews.author: Tiffany

customer_reviews.title: My favorite
customer_reviews.text: I really like this brand over Garden of Life ones. Know though, you have to take them 3x a day. Way better than ones that contain fish oil. 3rd pregnancy and I’m barely learning. The fish oil ones add to my nausea. These were a game changer for me.
customer_reviews.author: Cyn O

customer_reviews.title: Great prenatal!
customer_reviews.text: Used these vitamins through my whole pregnancy, and now postpartum. I never had an issue taking these on an empty stomach, even during the first trimester. Plus, the subscription option meant I didn’t have to think about running out!
customer_reviews.author: Allison

customer_reviews.title: It has wheat, you might have a reaction.
customer_reviews.text: So this said it was gluten free, but the main ingredient is wheat, and I had a huge reaction after taking it. I couldn't return it after opening it, of course. Total waste of money. Buyers beware.
customer_reviews.author: beeofbeirut

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely the worst! I got intensely sick from these and they ...
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely the worst! I got intensely sick from these and they caused me to start my period early. I was so sick I thought I was poisoned and going to go to the ER. Do not buy!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Erica Messick

customer_reviews.title: better than other brands.
customer_reviews.text: At the moment I am about to hit my 2nd trimester and have been taking these ever since the other "high" brand gave me terrible side effects during the night. I took these the next day, and never had an issue with morning sickness again, huge relief let me tell you. So yeah, definitely sticking with these over any 1-a-day pill any day.
customer_reviews.author: spicy

customer_reviews.title: Perfect prenatal
customer_reviews.text: These are very gentle. I’m thrilled that I can take them on an empty stomach. The flavor isn’t great but the ingredients are. I would for sure recommend these to any mommy to be out there having morning sickness or not having an appetite.
customer_reviews.author: Angelina

customer_reviews.title: Morning sickness CURE
customer_reviews.text: No joke. I got these for my wife it she stopped being nauseous in no time. They also have everything you'll need in them.
customer_reviews.author: Q

customer_reviews.title: Great quality.
customer_reviews.text: Flavor isn’t great have to take with juice but all organic similar grade vitamins multi taste bad to me.
customer_reviews.author: Carol

customer_reviews.title: Have been taking these vitamins for quite a few months ...
customer_reviews.text: Have been taking these vitamins for quite a few months and my body likes them. I take them with or without food and never get an upset stomach. Am trying to keep my body healthy since my husband and I are trying to have a baby.
customer_reviews.author: Jessenia Marrero

customer_reviews.title: Don't recommend... You have to take 3 A DAY!
customer_reviews.text: These don't taste good at all. And I wish I had read more carefully and realized that you have to take 3 in day! Plus, there was a lot of borken ones! I wouldn't not recommend them. I think if I was pregnant, the smell and taste of these would make me gag as they are terrible.
customer_reviews.author: Elisabeth Ellsworth

customer_reviews.title: YESSS
customer_reviews.text: I was dealing with nausea still going into my second trimester but when I switched to these prenatals, the nausea dissipated and I got some more of my energy back! Definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel Tucker

customer_reviews.title: Pills are good but not the bottle
customer_reviews.text: This is my 2nd bottle but it was broken when I opened package.
customer_reviews.author: AJ

customer_reviews.title: Love them
customer_reviews.text: I love this vitamins , my hair is not falling anymore , my nails are getting hard and I’m not even pregnant yet!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: couldn't keep them down
customer_reviews.text: i have no doubt that these are very high quality vitamins, but i couldn't benefit from them because I simply could not keep them down. They have a terrible smell to them (this is not unique to them...for whatever reason this is true of many prenatals), which only exacerbated my heightened up-chuck reflex. however, i do think they are worth a try, esp if you are fortunate enough to have little morning sickness. sadly, this wasn't the case for me! i had to go with the more palatable (but i'm sure nutritionally inferior) gummy prenatals.
customer_reviews.author: A. Coats

customer_reviews.title: So mad for all the broken pieces I received!
customer_reviews.text: This review is about the broken pieces that I had received. Half of my vitamins are not useable. The first time I ordered it everything was fine and I decided to reorder and this is what I get!?
customer_reviews.author: wok star

customer_reviews.title: They came recommended by my midwife because they contain the right amount ...
customer_reviews.text: I have used these vitamins throughout my 2nd and 3rd pregnancy. They came recommended by my midwife because they contain the right amount of vitamins and folic acid. To avoid morning sickness triggered by prenatals, I usually take them at night before bed.
customer_reviews.author: Zibby

customer_reviews.title: No thanks
customer_reviews.text: These made my head hurt and me queasy. I can take all other brands of prenatals but this one upsets my stomach every time.
customer_reviews.author: Cat

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t contain DHA :/
customer_reviews.text: I had been taking a different prenatal but thought I’d mix it up and try these for a month or so as a friend recommended... I’d like to like this one more, but it does not contain DHA! Not sure this is the best choice for a prenatal...
customer_reviews.author: Conscientious Consumer🌷

customer_reviews.title: Great! Will buy again and again
customer_reviews.text: I really like these, I take them with a meal just in case. My first bottle arrived shattered they promptly sent me another right away. I sent an email and they had another bottle on my door step the next day Sunday yes Sunday. Very happy.
customer_reviews.author: r

customer_reviews.title: Great Flavor!
customer_reviews.text: My wife loves these prenatal pills and was recommended by the doctor over the one the clinic prescribed. I recommend buying these prenatal vitamins.
customer_reviews.author: Keitel Millet Jr

customer_reviews.title: Was given post natal instead of prenatal vitamins
customer_reviews.text: Was given one bottle of prenatal vitamins and two bottles of post natal vitamins. I am feeling super frustrated. I ordered these vitamins for our surrogate and and only 1 out of 3 bottles was correct. I need the other two bottles to be replaced with the correct prenatal vitamins, the ones I ordered and paid for. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Aveon Colaizzi

customer_reviews.title: Does not make me sick or throw up
customer_reviews.text: I did get a prescription from my doctor initially that make me throw up all day and after some researcher I tried these and they are amazing. No nauseous or sickness.
customer_reviews.author: Mel

customer_reviews.title: Because the dosage is 3 pills, and the pills ...
customer_reviews.text: Because the dosage is 3 pills, and the pills are SO large, it was difficult to get them down. Plus, they start to smell and taste a bit "off" before the 30 day supply is finished.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda Huffer

customer_reviews.title: I am very pleased with this blend
customer_reviews.text: I've never had a vitamin that I can take on an empty stomach until now. These seem to help with my day time fatigue as well. I am very pleased with this blend:)
customer_reviews.author: sarah

customer_reviews.title: Excellent, easy on the stomach and schedule
customer_reviews.text: The best multivitamin I have tried. My favorite part is that it can be taken any time during the day, and on an empty stomach. My challenge with other multivitamins was that I needed to ear first, so I would simply forget to take them after the meal. With these ones, I can take them any time which ensures that I take them every day.
customer_reviews.author: GrlRdr

customer_reviews.title: Thumbs up!
customer_reviews.text: They are a little big, and they tasted really gross! Lol but they were a good prenatal as far as what I needed for my little guys!! :)
customer_reviews.author: Jacklyn Sands

customer_reviews.title: The best prenatals
customer_reviews.text: These really are the best I've tried, and I'm going on my 4th pregancy here! Easily digested and full of goodness! I love that they are 3 a day because you get an even steady flow of nutrients that your body will actually absorb, as opposed to the once a day slam of vitamins that you mostly pee out. (what a waste!) I love that my energy level feels positivly affected by this formula. I'm not saying I'm ready to build a house, although I have considered it, but I just feel evened out, not rediculously tired!
customer_reviews.author: Wendy Lady

customer_reviews.title: Made me sick.
customer_reviews.text: These gave me diarrhea. Plus you have to take 3 capsules to get a serving. My doctor said these didn’t have enough folic acid.
customer_reviews.author: Allison

customer_reviews.title: Not impressed!
customer_reviews.text: Huge pills that were hard to swallow for me. I found a less expensive alternative.
customer_reviews.author: Christi C

customer_reviews.title: 2nd pregnancy taking these and Love them!
customer_reviews.text: I’ve never had any regrets through either pregnancy taking these vitamins. Although I usually take them with my meal, they have never given me trouble on an empty stomach either. Overall I’m really happy with this brand.
customer_reviews.author: Alyson

customer_reviews.title: Don’t  use this
customer_reviews.text: Definitely the worst prenatal vitamines I’ve ever used. Whenever I take only one vitamin a day makes me feel so sick, I dint know if it’s me or the vitamins until I changed them.. Makes you throw up and Smells very bad.. I don’t recommend this Prenatal vitamines at all..
customer_reviews.author: Emilija P.

customer_reviews.title: The best prenatals I have tried!
customer_reviews.text: Been taking these my whole second pregnancy. Love them I truly think they have helped with morning sickness and over all feeling good.
customer_reviews.author: Jessy Sampson

customer_reviews.title: Would buy again!
customer_reviews.text: Love this s product and great price! Nice and convenient to buy on Amazon verses the grocery store!
customer_reviews.author: Happy walker

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: Perfect vitamins. Used them for first and second pregnancy. No foul taste or after taste.
customer_reviews.author: Ziggy

customer_reviews.title: Works wonders for hair, skin and nails!
customer_reviews.text: My doctor recommended I start taking prenatal vitamins after my nails were breaking and these work wonders. I take these about every third day after the initial bottle and my nails and skin glows.
customer_reviews.author: Jenya Rubanova

customer_reviews.title: Ginger helped my morning sickness
customer_reviews.text: With having morning sickness all day and night long, I wanted to find a way to get ginger in my life. This prenatal was the perfect solution.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Broken bottle
customer_reviews.text: Love this product but Amazon delivered a broken bottle. Not helpful...hopefully the replacement will be in one piece...
customer_reviews.author: Karen Furlong

customer_reviews.title: Best multi vitamin out there!
customer_reviews.text: Highly recommend these vitamins!!! A friend bought a bottle for me after chemo. I haven't been sick once, don't taste fish oil (like so many prenatal vitamins do), and they don't upset stomach. Plus my hair is growing in thick. Will continue to buy these!
customer_reviews.author: Katrina

customer_reviews.title: You have to take 3! Not worth it.
customer_reviews.text: You have to take 3 of them. It’s hard enough to swallow one when you’re nauseous.Doesn’t make sense. Rainbow brand is way better. One pill and done.
customer_reviews.author: caroline

customer_reviews.title: Necessary for postnatal breastfeeding moms
customer_reviews.text: Breastfeeding momma with lots of hair loss. After about 1 month little hairs are making growing progress already. Very impressed. Will continue to buy.
customer_reviews.author: Julia Semeia

customer_reviews.title: Very happy with these
customer_reviews.text: I am really enjoying these vitamins so far. They do have a slight odor comparable to a rabbit food pellet however I do not have the problem with tasting that. I get indigestion a lot and even if I burp I do not taste it once it is down. The serving size is 3 but they are on the smaller side so I am not gagging. Also I am not having constipation issues with this vitamin. I was using Buried treasure prenatal liquid vitamins but due to my increased sensitive gag reflex I couldn't swallow them. Ordered the smaller bottle to test out but think I will stick with these from here on out.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica

customer_reviews.title: Highly Recommended
customer_reviews.text: I have tried a few different prenatal vitamins and these have agreed the best with my tummy and system. The only draw back is you have to take three a day, but it still beats the horse pills that other brands have to offer. They don't taste as badly as other vitamins and are easier to swallow. I also like the extra supplements offered in these formula. I would definitely recommend it to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Joe's Wife

customer_reviews.title: Love Love
customer_reviews.text: Best vitamins I've ever taken! Love the Folate intake in this! Will definitely be buying more soon !!
customer_reviews.author: Matthew O'Donnell

customer_reviews.title: Glass bottle arrived broken
customer_reviews.text: I like this product but it arrived damaged (the bottle was broken in 3 places) and the vitamins were mixed with broken glass so had to throw the entire package away.
customer_reviews.author: Rory

customer_reviews.title: So far so good!
customer_reviews.text: So far so good! I have not had any side effects from this product. After reading some of the other reviews I may have to look over the ingredients list again. I will update you guys with what I find!
customer_reviews.author: Debra

customer_reviews.title: Made me break out in hives!
customer_reviews.text: I didn’t have a problem with this product, except that it made me break out into a terrible itchy rash! It was a very delayed onset, so it took me about 3 weeks to figure it out. Once I stopped taking it, it cleared up in a few days. Might be a reaction someone else could have.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah A. Brewer

customer_reviews.title: Decent
customer_reviews.text: Flavor was gross but ingredients and ability to swallow was easy.
customer_reviews.author: Hurricane

customer_reviews.title: NOT folate
customer_reviews.text: Trash. These are not even FOLATE like the label says they are folic acid. If I wanted folic acid I could buy that at Walmart for 1/2 the price.
customer_reviews.author: Mandi

customer_reviews.title: Great Prenatal Vitamin with Probiotics
customer_reviews.text: This is the best prenatal vitamin. Gentle on your stomach, and a good source of everything you need as a woman, whether or not you’re trying to conceive.
customer_reviews.author: Colleen C. Franco

customer_reviews.title: Not easy to swallow
customer_reviews.text: The pills are waaay to large and I haven't had idea you are supposed to take 3 a day. That's a lot.
customer_reviews.author: Julia Sanchis

customer_reviews.title: Super happy with these prenatals
customer_reviews.text: Super happy with these prenatals! Its important to me to take food based, vegetarian prenatals but most make me gag or worse throw up. Second pregnancy and I swear by these!
customer_reviews.author: RandallMcMandall

customer_reviews.title: No upset stomach !!
customer_reviews.text: I wasnt sure what to expect with these as my stomach is sensitive with certain things. I took this on an empty stomach like it says I can and it did not cause any stomach upset. I am extremely happy with this product
customer_reviews.author: AwesomeReviews

customer_reviews.title: Favorite Prenatal Vitamins
customer_reviews.text: I have taken these prenatals thru two pregnancies and love them. They don't make me feel nauseous if i take on a empty stomach. The only con is taking 3 a day, but I don't have any issues with this.
customer_reviews.author: C_BEV

customer_reviews.title: No issues with this bothering my stomach!
customer_reviews.text: I love new chapter products - I have taken their vitamins for a few years now. The obvious choice when I got pregnant was their prenatal, and I have had no issues at all with it bothering my stomach. Sometimes I have a hard time remembering to take all three pills, but that's a personal problem... I love knowing that the product is safe and natural, and therefore the three pills a day is definitely worth it to me.
customer_reviews.author: IntelegantBlonde

customer_reviews.title: Prenatal seem to be working great! I can take on empty or full stomach ...
customer_reviews.text: Prenatal seem to be working great! I can take on empty or full stomach without getting sick. The only down fall is that a serving is three pills
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Sell

customer_reviews.title: Note it is 3 not 1 a day
customer_reviews.text: You need to take 3 a day so this ended up being much more expensive than I’d thought in buying it. Unfortunately I never notice a difference in taking vitamins but this one seems high quality.
customer_reviews.author: Adam

customer_reviews.title: Great staff
customer_reviews.text: Works for me . I do feel a difference then I take them . Some pills may be broken , then I keep them to the end . Other then this no issues. And yes, they can be taken on the empty stomach without any problems .
customer_reviews.author: Serge

customer_reviews.title: Three times a day.
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this for about a week, and it seems to be doing the job. The only thing I don't like is having to take it three times a day. I should have checked that first!
customer_reviews.author: Brittin Anderson

customer_reviews.title: ... years ago and I thought these vitamins would be easy to digest
customer_reviews.text: I had my gall bladder removed several years ago and I thought these vitamins would be easy to digest, but they are turning out to be a major cause of my pregnancy heartburn/indigestion.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It's my third bottle. I will deliver after i ...
customer_reviews.text: It's my third bottle. I will deliver after i finish this one. The only con is you need to eat 3 pills per day.
customer_reviews.author: Amber Smith

customer_reviews.title: It's really true - easy on the stomach.
customer_reviews.text: I ALWAYS have some sort of GI reaction to any type of vitamin or pill on an empty stomach. I like that I can take this in the morning on an empty stomach and I don't burp or have any acid issues in my stomach. I love that it's organic. It stinks, but just swallow it up and the smell never returns. I'm so glad I found them.
customer_reviews.author: litelnole

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Product for Mother of a Baby.
customer_reviews.text: Very cool product.It helped a lot during pregnancy,especially on morning sickness -Obviously it is meant for Vitamins it served the purpose.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I've been taking these vitamins for a while. Taking ...
customer_reviews.text: I've been taking these vitamins for a while. Taking them do not make me feel nauseous. However, they smell really strong, so I often have to hurry and take them before I get nauseous from the smell. Once, a few of them spilled out in my overnight bag and the smell was on my clothes. I had to douse them in febreeze so they don't smell weird all day.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Don't have what pregnant Mama's really need. Don't be scammed by "natural herbal blends"
customer_reviews.text: I am so disappointed in this pre natal. First of all, I overlooked that you need 3 pills per day. Second of all, WAY TOO MUCH biotin (you don't need this much during pregnancy!) And it made me break out terribly. Third, not enough calcium (6% DV in 3 pills). Fourth, only 75% DV in FOLIC ACID!!!
customer_reviews.author: Ashley Brower

customer_reviews.title: Not the greatest for some.
customer_reviews.text: My wife said they give her heartburn, We got the prenatal vitamins from the doctor and they do not.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan J maturi

customer_reviews.title: 3/day
customer_reviews.text: Seems very good. Like a lot, just didn't realize it was a 3/day thing. Will not last as long as i hoped.
customer_reviews.author: BKA

customer_reviews.title: Causes constipation
customer_reviews.text: Tried this brand from the previous one I was using before. This one gave me terrible constipation.
customer_reviews.author: Vk

customer_reviews.title: healthy choice
customer_reviews.text: These are great prenatal vitamins. I've never felt sick after taking them, always feel better when I remember to take them. I continue to take them even now that I've had my baby and am done breastfeeding. They are definitely worth the price and worth taking the three recommended daily. I'm not sure if I will ever stray from New Chapter as long as they keep up the high quality.
customer_reviews.author: pandabear

product_meta.title: New Chapter Perfect Prenatal Vitamins, 96ct, Organic Prenatal Vitamins, Non-GMO Ingredients for Healthy Baby & Mom - Folate (Methylfolate), Iron, Vitamin D3, Fermented with Whole Foods and Probiotics
product_meta.description: When you're pregnant or planning to be, you're naturally looking for the best prenatal vitamins. But how do you choose the best one for you? For peace of mind, New Chapter’s Perfect Prenatal vitamins are made with organic whole-food ingredients and fermented to unlock each nutrient for your body to absorb, just like food. Moms love that Perfect Prenatal is formulated with Methylfolate, the most bioactive form of Folate, a B vitamin that is vital for your baby’s brain & spinal cord development. It’s a complete prenatal vitamin to support preconception, healthy pregnancy & fetal development - to nourish the two of you every step of the way. Additionally, it includes non-constipating Iron (not found in gummies) for red blood cell production & B Vitamins for natural Energy Support, Vitamin D3 for Heart Support; Vitamin C, A & Zinc for Immune Support. New Chapter’s Prenatal includes Ginger for your nausea relief, and is so gentle you can take it anytime—even on an empty stomach. Made with Organic, Non-GMO, whole-food & premium ingredients. For prenatal DHA, add New Chapter Wholemega for Moms fish oil supplement for baby’s brain & eye health.
feature_bullets: COMPLETE PRENATAL VITAMIN with Folate for baby’s healthy brain & spinal cord development
EASY TO TAKE ANYTIME: Gentle on an empty stomach. Eases morning sickness with clinical dose of Organic Ginger

4 NUTRIENT-PACKED TABLETS with superfoods and safe herbs plus fermented nutrients to support baby’s healthy development and mom’s healthy pregnancy. 100% Daily Value of Iron, plus Folate, B Vitamins, Vitamin D3, Vitamin C, A & Zinc.

METHYLFOLATE & IRON: Methylfolate, the most active form of Folate, for baby’s healthy brain & spinal cord development as recommended by OB/GYNS. Non-constipating fermented Iron to boost mom’s natural energy during pregnancy

2nd PRENATAL VITAMIN to be made with Certified Organic Vegetables & Herbs, Non-GMO Project Verified, 100% Vegetarian, Certified Kosher, Certified Gluten-Free by NSF, No Added Sugar, No Animal Gelatin (added to some prenatal gummy vitamins)
Look for “Ships from and sold by Amazon.com” when adding to cart to ensure you are buying genuine New Chapter products with current dating.
